00002  *  maven Programming Language

00005 
00006 #include "maven.h"
00007 #include "struct_MavenCompiler.h"
00008 #include "strings.h"
00009 #include "errors.h"
00010 
00011 void printErrors(MavenCompiler* c) {
00012         for(int i = 0; i < c->errors.length(); ++i) {
00013                 if(c->errors[i].level == MAVEN_ERROR) cerr << "Error";
00014                 else if(c->errors[i].level == MAVEN_WARNING) {
00015                         cerr << "Warning";
00016                         if(c->errors[i].file != "" || c->errors[i].line > 0)
00017                                 cerr << " (";
00018                         if(c->errors[i].file != "")
00019                                 cerr << c->errors[i].file;
00020                         if(c->errors[i].line > 0)
00021                                 cerr << ", line " << c->errors[i].line;
00022                         if(c->errors[i].file != "" || c->errors[i].line > 0)
00023                                 cerr << ")";
00024                         cerr << ": ";
00025                         fprintf(stderr, c->errors[i].message.c_str(), c->errors[i].arg1.c_str(),
00026                                         c->errors[i].arg2.c_str());
00027                         cerr << endl;
00028                         continue;
00029                 }
00030                 
00031                 // because errors are pushed in a chronolical order, if there are multiple
00032                 // errors on the same line we can reverse them to show the path of what went wrong
00033                 int grouped = 0;
00034                 while(i + grouped < c->errors.length() &&
00035                           c->errors[i].file == c->errors[i + grouped].file &&
00036                           c->errors[i].line == c->errors[i + grouped].line)
00037                         ++grouped;
00038                 
00039                 reverseErrors(c, i, grouped);
00040                 int pad = 0;
00041                 string msg = "";
00042                 if(c->errors[i].file.length() > 0)
00043                         msg = string(" (") + c->errors[i].file + ", line " +
00044                         intToString(c->errors[i].line) + "): ";
00045                 else msg = ": ";
00046                 pad = msg.length();
00047                 cerr << msg;
00048                 
00049                 for(int j = 0; j < grouped; ++j) {
00050                         // this is to align the '>>'
00051                         if(j > 0) {
00052                                 //for(int p = 0; p < pad; ++p) cerr << " ";
00053                                 fprintf(stderr, "  >> ");
00054                         }
00055                         fprintf(stderr, c->errors[i + j].message.c_str(),
00056                                         c->errors[i + j].arg1.c_str(), c->errors[i + j].arg2.c_str());
00057                         cerr << endl;
00058                 }
00059                 
00060                 i += grouped;
00061         }
00062 }
